ğŸ” How to Generate Secure Token
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

Setup Admin Access:
â–¡ Generate token: python3 -c "import secrets; print(secrets.token_urlsafe(32))"
â–¡ Add to backend env: echo "ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN=..." >> /opt/mact/deployment/mact-backend.env
â–¡ Add to shell: echo "export ADMIN_AUTH_TOKEN=..." >> ~/.bashrc
â–¡ Restart backend: sudo systemctl restart mact-backend
â–¡ Test: mact-admin rooms list

Verify Security:
â–¡ Backend listens on 127.0.0.1:5000 (NOT 0.0.0.0)
â–¡ SSH uses key-based auth (not passwords)
â–¡ Admin token is 32+ characters
â–¡ Token not committed to git
â–¡ UFW firewall enabled
â–¡ Nginx properly configured

Test Public Access:
â–¡ Developer can: mact create TestProject -port 3000
â–¡ Developer cannot: curl https://m-act.live/admin/rooms

Test Admin Access:
â–¡ SSH to server works
â–¡ mact-admin --help works
â–¡ mact-admin system health shows status
â–¡ mact-admin rooms list shows all rooms
